definition: to welcome/to meet/to face/to forge ahead (esp. in the face of difficulties)
to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before

sentences.english: Welcome to the official launch by IBM of Shanghai.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨IBM上海公司的正式開張典禮。

sentences.english: Welcome to Giant store, I can provide with any help?
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨捷安特專賣店，我能爲您做些什麼？

sentences.english: Welcome to this scenic place, where you'll find an endless enjoyment for your holiday.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨風韻之境，給您的假日增添無窮樂趣。

sentences.english: Welcome to Ouran High School HostClub…
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨櫻蘭高校男公關部。

sentences.english: Welcome to Shui Mu Nian Hua Bath Club.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨水木年華沐浴休閒俱樂部。

sentences.english: Welcome to Four Seasons Resort Nevis, West Indies.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨尼維斯四季度假村，西印度羣島。

sentences.english: Hello, Welcome to Zhejiang Commodity Net.
sentences.chinese: 你好，歡迎光臨浙商小商品網。

sentences.english: S:welcome.It seems you’re interested in this dress.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨，你好像對這件衣服感興趣。

sentences.english: Welcome here. You can look around freely, and try something on if you like it.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨，挑挑看有沒有喜歡的，可以試戴。

sentences.english: Welcome to Shanghai Import and Export Commodities Fair.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨上海進出口商品交易會。

sentences.english: Eby, welcome to the Easter factory.
sentences.chinese: 伊比，歡迎光臨復活節工廚。
歡迎光臨明星匪幫風格。

sentences.english: Welcome to Four Seasons Hotel México, D.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨墨西哥四季酒店，D。

sentences.english: Welcome to Four Seasons Resort Lana'i at Manele Bay.
sentences.chinese: 歡迎光臨拉奈島馬內爾灣四季度假村。

definition: see you tomorrow/(coll., jocular) food that passes through the digestive system more or less intact (esp. enoki mushrooms)
(slang) (used at the end of a sentence to mimic Korean speech) (loanword from Korean verb ending "seumnida")/(jocularly) a Korean
to buy soy sauce/it's none of my business ("I’m just here to buy some soy sauce")
Dalian subprovincial city in Liaoning province 遼寧省|辽宁省 in northeast China
prologue of play/opening remarks/preamble (of speeches, articles etc)
